column1: In the circulatory system, why does an increase in cardiac output cause an increase in volume flow rate (of blood)? Because:
column2: an increased cardiac output causes vasoconstriction.
column3: as cardiac output increases so blood viscosity increases.
column4: as cardiac output increases, the resistance of the systemic circulation to blood flow decreases.
column5: cardiac output and volume flow rate are the same thing
column22: blood, flow, in, increase, of, rate, system, volume

column1: What effect is achieved by having an arteriole that supplies blood and another that drains blood from the glomerulus?
column2: oxygen rich blood can be supplied to the nephron after blood leaves the glomerulus
column3: the blood pressure within the glomerulus can be manipulated.
column4: reabsorption of water and nutrients from the ﬁ ltrate is facilitated.
column5: the concentration gradient within the kidney’s medulla can be maintained.
